headline: Linux Is Buggy
description:
I've been trying Linux Mint for more than a year after using Windows 7, and now I'm considering switching back.

I have good hardware: Ryzen 3900x, 32Gb RAM, SSD.

These are some of the bugs:

1. Mouse gets stuck in the drag mode once in a while (tested in Ubuntu / Mint / Wayland / Xorg). Perhaps this is the bug, it exists since 2009 and it's not getting any traction: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rapidsvn/+bug/402892

If this happens while dragging something on the panel, all the input freezes, and then I must restart lightdm, which closes all running applications.

2. Nemo sometimes simply crashed.

3. There were times when the system just logged out or failed to resume from suspend.

4. Recently the sound system started failing after suspend, and then it's impossible (or takes half an hour) to shutdown the PC without holding the power button.

These are not even Nvidia related bugs, it's just the core functionality of Linux acting up and not getting fixed.

Like why would that mouse behavior not be addressed? I've seen many people talking about it.

Then Linux Mint developers for some reason put Ctrl-Alt-Backspace shortcut into startup applications, while Ubuntu disabled this shortcut (https://wiki.ubuntu.com/XorgCtrlAltBackspace), which resulted in me constantly being logged out and it took months to find out the cause (restarting the X server).

Today after booting up I couldn't switch the keyboard layout, the shortcut simply didn't do anything.

On the other (older) computers where I tried Linux, the system wouldn't shut down correctly or had multiple other bugs, while Windows 7 worked stably.

Before switching to Linux, I had been using a Windows 7 computer for several years on much older hardware and mostly didn't have any issues. I didn't receive any system updates (only once probably), the system didn't crash unexpectedly, the mouse / tablet worked fine. The sound worked fine. I didn't have to troubleshoot constant problems, searching the Internet for hours. I could just use it.

But I could be ok with these bugs, I could just reinstall Linux and try to not upgrade and so I would probably not face most of the bugs. But this issue with the mouse getting stuck in the drag mode is probably going to be the last straw for me to switch back to Windows, unless Linux devs finally look at this issue:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rapidsvn/+bug/402892 (exists since 2009) https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/1961034 (is probably a duplicate of the previous one)
description_zh-Hans:
在使用Windows 7之后，我已经尝试Linux Mint一年多了，现在我正在考虑换回来。

我有良好的硬件。Ryzen 3900x，32Gb内存，SSD。

这些是一些bug：

1. 鼠标偶尔会卡在拖动模式（在Ubuntu / Mint / Wayland / Xorg中测试）。也许这就是bug，它从2009年就存在，而且没有得到任何牵引力：https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rapidsvn/+bug/402892

如果在面板上拖动东西时发生这种情况，所有的输入都会冻结，然后我必须重新启动lightdm，关闭所有正在运行的应用程序。

2.Nemo有时干脆崩溃了。

3.

4.最近，声音系统在挂起后开始失效，然后不按住电源按钮就无法（或需要半小时）关闭电脑。

这些甚至不是与Nvidia有关的bug，只是Linux的核心功能出现问题，而且没有得到修复。

比如，为什么那个鼠标行为不被解决？我看到很多人都在谈论这个问题。

后来，Linux Mint的开发者出于某种原因将Ctrl-Alt-Backspace快捷键放入了启动程序中，而Ubuntu则禁用了这个快捷键（https://wiki.ubuntu.com/XorgCtrlAltBackspace），这导致我不断被注销，花了几个月时间才找到原因（重新启动X服务器）。

今天开机后，我无法切换键盘布局，这个快捷键根本没有任何作用。

在我尝试过Linux的其他（较老的）电脑上，系统无法正确关闭或有其他多种错误，而Windows 7则工作稳定。

在切换到Linux之前，我已经在更老的硬件上使用Windows 7电脑好几年了，大部分时间没有任何问题。我没有收到任何系统更新（可能只有一次），系统没有意外崩溃，鼠标/平板电脑工作正常。声音工作正常。我不需要不断地排查问题，在互联网上搜索几个小时。我可以直接使用它。

但我可以接受这些错误，我可以重新安装Linux，尽量不升级，这样我可能就不会面对大多数的错误。但是这个鼠标被卡在拖动模式的问题可能会成为我转回Windows的最后一根稻草，除非Linux开发者最终关注这个问题：

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rapidsvn/+bug/402892（2009年就存在）。 https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/1961034 (可能是与前一个重复的问题)
